intro: Antinoria agrostidea var. algeriensis, commonly known as Algerian antinoria, is a flowering plant native to North Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and is adapted to arid environments. It features small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, and its leaves are finely divided and often fragrant. This variety is of interest to botanists and horticulturists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
